properties.prefix:
Cultural Heritage Entity or Object


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the object being described. This is the primary way of naming this object in the system.
properties.title: Primary Title

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the object in the context of your research.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of alternate title such as Abbreviation or Display Title.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: Alternate name, label or formal title of the entity being described in the record.
properties.title: Alternate Title

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the object
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the object and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as Subject, Geographic or Temporal. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: The primary classification of the object.
properties.title: Object Class

properties.description: The sub-classification of the object.
properties.title: Object Sub-Class

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the object in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the object for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: A standard identifier for the entity, e.g. ISSN, opus no., etc., or a URI.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the object, such as the name of a larger object or entity of which the object being described was a part.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the object, such as ornament notes, symbolism, excavation notes, etc., and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: The type of note such as Catalog Notes, Accession Notes, etc.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the object, such as the year it was created, accessioned or excavated.
properties.title: Time Period

properties.description: The type of time period such as Date Created.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the last voyage of Sinbad", "the 20th Century".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the object being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: Current or historical spatial location information about the object being described, such as place of creation, collection or current storage.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as, the Collection place or the Storage location.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the entity being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the place is relevant to the object.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of date related to the place.
properties.title: Place Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the last voyage of Sinbad", "the 20th Century".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations which have a special relationship to the object. For example, the person who created it, or an organization which has included it in their collection.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of a person related to the object, such as “creator”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of an organization related to the object, such as “repository” or “owner”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: Used to describe physical characteristics of the object. For example, decorative detail, etc.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: The type of thing being described such as Decorative Detail.
properties.title: Physical Description Type

properties.description: Currently observed state of the object being described.
properties.title: Condition

properties.description: The type of condition you are describing such as Corrosion, Coloration, or use marks.
properties.title: Condition Type

properties.description: A description of such things as the object's historical or cultural context.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: The type of context being described such as Cultural or Historical.
properties.title: Context Type

properties.description: Stylistic name or period, e.g. Baroque, Bebop, etc.
properties.title: Style

properties.description: The type of style being described.
properties.title: Style Type

properties.description: Brief text about the style.
properties.title: Style

properties.description: For physical entities, what it is made of.
properties.title: Materials

properties.description: The type of material being described.
properties.title: Material Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the material of the object.
properties.title: Material

properties.description: Describes the techniques used in the making of an object.
properties.title: Techniques

properties.description: The type of techniques used to describe the object such as Joinery, Finishing, Fabrication, etc.
properties.title: Technique Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the technique.
properties.title: Technique

properties.description: Description of the processes or methods used in the preservation or alteration of the object.
properties.title: Treatment

properties.description: The type of treatment being described.
properties.title: Treatment Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the treatment.
properties.title: Treatment

properties.description: Textual or numeric measurements pertaining to the object being described, when the measurements were taken and notes on their accuracy.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are just a string of text. For example, “L 12 inches; H 6 inches”.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: A measurement intended to be a single dimension using a combination of the type, value and units attributes.
properties.title: Numeric Measurements

properties.description: The type of measurement such as depth, circumference, length, width or height.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: Unit of measurement such as feet, inches, centimeters, etc.
properties.title: Measurement Unit

properties.description: The dates pertaining to a measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Dates

properties.description: The type of date associated with the measurement.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the last voyage of Sinbad", "the 20th Century".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A numeric date associated with the measurement being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy
